unnormalised: IIT Bombay researchers have preponed the launch of their new robotics kit, originally slated for 15/08/2024. The kit, priced at â‚¹2500, is aimed at engineering students and hobbyists across India.
normalised: I-I-T Bombay researchers have preponed the launch of their new robotics kit, originally slated for fifteenth august two thousand and twenty four. The kit, priced at rupee two thousand five hundred, is aimed at engineering students and hobbyists across India.

unnormalised: The project lead, Dr. Meena Sharma, said the preponement was due to overwhelming demand. Apparently, they received over 1000 pre-orders within 24 hrs of announcing it on LinkedIn. She mentioned, "We underestimated the enthusiasm! We're working round the clock to meet the demand."
normalised: The project lead, Dr. Meena Sharma, said the preponement was due to overwhelming demand. Apparently, they received over one thousand pre-orders within twenty four hours of announcing it on L-inked-I-n. She mentioned, "We underestimated the enthusiasm! We're working round the clock to meet the demand."

unnormalised: The kit includes components for building 3 different types of robots, with code compatible with Raspberry Pi 4 and Arduino Uno. Its key feature? It comes with 8 GB of pre-loaded content, including tutorials and project examples.
normalised: The kit includes components for building three different types of robots, with code compatible with Raspberry Pi four and Arduino Uno. Its key feature? It comes with eight gigabyte of pre-loaded content, including tutorials and project examples.

unnormalised: This move could really prepone India's robotics scene, making tech more accessible. Seems like IIT Bombay is really trying to "make in India" with this one, targeting the next generation of robotic engineers.
normalised: This move could really prepone India's robotics scene, making tech more accessible. Seems like I-I-T Bombay is really trying to "make in India" with this one, targeting the next generation of robotic engineers.
